title: Enacts the "improper payments reporting and reduction act" to require state agencies to annually report on its improper payments and to seek a reduction thereof
summary: Enacts the "improper payments reporting and reduction act" to require state agencies to annually report on their improper payments and to seek to reduce or eliminate such payments.

                                         1677

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 11, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced   by   Sens.   KLEIN,   LITTLE,   MAZIARZ,  PERALTA,  SAVINO,
         STEWART-COUSINS, VALESKY -- read twice and ordered printed,  and  when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Finance

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to enacting the "improper
         payments reporting and reduction act"

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The executive law is amended by adding a new article 4-B to
    2  read as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE 4-B
    4                IMPROPER PAYMENTS REPORTING AND REDUCTION ACT
    5  SECTION 56.   SHORT TITLE.
    6          56-A. DEFINITIONS.
    7          57.   IDENTIFICATION OF SUSCEPTIBLE PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES.
    8          57-A. ESTIMATION OF IMPROPER PAYMENTS.
    9          57-B. REPORTS ON ACTIONS TO REDUCE IMPROPER PAYMENTS.
   10          58.   IMPROPER PAYMENT ESTIMATE GUIDANCE GROUP.
   11          59.   APPLICATION OF ARTICLE.
   12    S 56. SHORT TITLE. THIS ARTICLE SHALL BE KNOWN AND MAY BE CITED AS THE
   13  "IMPROPER PAYMENTS REPORTING AND REDUCTION ACT".
   14    S 56-A. DEFINITIONS. AS USED IN  THIS  ARTICLE,  THE  FOLLOWING  TERMS
   15  SHALL MEAN:
   16    1.  "AGENCY"  MEANS ANY EXECUTIVE BRANCH AGENCY, DEPARTMENT, DIVISION,
   17  OFFICE, BOARD, COMMISSION, PUBLIC AUTHORITY (OTHER THAN A MULTI-STATE OR
   18  MULTI-NATIONAL AUTHORITY) OR PUBLIC BENEFIT CORPORATION, WITH AN  ANNUAL
   19  BUDGET  OF  AT  LEAST  TWENTY  MILLION  DOLLARS,  THE  HEAD  OF WHICH IS
   20  APPOINTED BY THE GOVERNOR.
   21    2. "IMPROPER PAYMENT" MEANS ANY PAYMENT THAT SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN MADE
   22  OR THAT WAS MADE IN AN  INCORRECT  AMOUNT,  INCLUDING  OVERPAYMENTS  AND
   23  UNDERPAYMENTS,  WHETHER  UNDER STATUTORY, CONTRACTUAL, ADMINISTRATIVE OR
   24  OTHER LEGALLY APPLICABLE REQUIREMENTS. SUCH TERM SHALL INCLUDE, BUT  NOT

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00681-01-1

       S. 1677                             2

    1  BE  LIMITED  TO, ANY PAYMENT TO AN INELIGIBLE RECIPIENT, ANY PAYMENT FOR
    2  AN INELIGIBLE SERVICE, ANY DUPLICATE PAYMENT, PAYMENTS FOR SERVICES  NOT
    3  RECEIVED AND ANY PAYMENT THAT DOES NOT ACCOUNT FOR CREDIT FOR APPLICABLE
    4  DISCOUNTS.
    5    3.  "PAYMENT"  MEANS  ANY  PAYMENT,  INCLUDING A COMMITMENT FOR FUTURE
    6  PAYMENT, THAT IS MADE BY AN AGENCY, A STATE  CONTRACTOR,  OR  A  GOVERN-
    7  MENTAL  OR OTHER ORGANIZATION ADMINISTERING A STATE PROGRAM OR ACTIVITY,
    8  AND WHICH DERIVED FROM STATE FUNDS OR OTHER  STATE  RESOURCES,  OR  THAT
    9  WILL BE REIMBURSED FROM STATE FUNDS OR OTHER STATE RESOURCES.
   10    S  57. IDENTIFICATION OF SUSCEPTIBLE PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES. THE HEAD
   11  OF EACH AGENCY SHALL, IN ACCORDANCE WITH GUIDELINES PROMULGATED PURSUANT
   12  TO SECTION FIFTY-EIGHT OF THIS ARTICLE, ANNUALLY REVIEW ALL PROGRAMS AND
   13  ACTIVITIES THAT IT ADMINISTERS,  AND  IDENTIFY  ALL  SUCH  PROGRAMS  AND
   14  ACTIVITIES THAT MAY BE SUSCEPTIBLE TO IMPROPER PAYMENTS.
   15    S  57-A. ESTIMATION OF IMPROPER PAYMENTS. WITH RESPECT TO EACH PROGRAM
   16  AND ACTIVITY IDENTIFIED IN SECTION FIFTY-SEVEN OF THIS ARTICLE, THE HEAD
   17  OF THE AGENCY SHALL:
   18    1. ESTIMATE THE ANNUAL AMOUNT OF IMPROPER PAYMENTS; AND
   19    2. REPORT SUCH ESTIMATE TO THE PUBLIC, AND THE CHAIRS  OF  THE  SENATE
   20  FINANCE COMMITTEE AND THE ASSEMBLY WAYS AND MEANS COMMITTEE ON OR BEFORE
   21  JANUARY  FIRST  OF  THE SUCCEEDING CALENDAR YEAR, AND SHALL BE POSTED ON
   22  THE AGENCY'S INTERNET WEBSITE AND ANY OTHER WEBSITE ESTABLISHED PURSUANT
   23  TO SECTION FIFTY-EIGHT OF THIS ARTICLE.
   24    ALL AGENCIES SHALL USE THE SAME METHOD OF REPORTING, AS PRESCRIBED  BY
   25  SECTION FIFTY-EIGHT OF THIS ARTICLE.
   26    S  57-B.  REPORTS ON ACTIONS TO REDUCE IMPROPER PAYMENTS. WITH RESPECT
   27  TO ANY PROGRAM  OR  ACTIVITY  OF  AN  AGENCY  WITH  IDENTIFIED  IMPROPER
   28  PAYMENTS  PURSUANT  TO  SECTION FIFTY-SEVEN OF THIS ARTICLE, THE HEAD OF
   29  THE  AGENCY  SHALL  INCLUDE  WITH  THE  ESTIMATE  PURSUANT  TO   SECTION
   30  FIFTY-SEVEN-A  OF  THIS  ARTICLE  A REPORT ON WHAT ACTIONS THE AGENCY IS
   31  TAKING TO REDUCE THE IMPROPER PAYMENTS, INCLUDING:
   32    1. A DISCUSSION OF THE CAUSES OF  THE  IMPROPER  PAYMENTS  IDENTIFIED,
   33  ACTIONS  TAKEN TO CORRECT THOSE CAUSES, AND RESULTS OF THE ACTIONS TAKEN
   34  TO ADDRESS THOSE CAUSES;
   35    2. A STATEMENT OF WHETHER THE AGENCY HAS THE INFORMATION  SYSTEMS  AND
   36  OTHER  INFRASTRUCTURE  IT  NEEDS IN ORDER TO REDUCE IMPROPER PAYMENTS TO
   37  MINIMAL COST-EFFECTIVE LEVELS;
   38    3. IF THE AGENCY DOES NOT HAVE  SUCH  SYSTEMS  AND  INFRASTRUCTURE,  A
   39  DESCRIPTION  OF  THE  RESOURCES  THE  AGENCY HAS REQUESTED IN ITS BUDGET
   40  SUBMISSION TO OBTAIN THE NECESSARY INFORMATION SYSTEMS  AND  INFRASTRUC-
   41  TURE; AND
   42    4.  A  DESCRIPTION  OF  THE  STEPS THE AGENCY HAS TAKEN TO ENSURE THAT
   43  AGENCY MANAGERS (INCLUDING THE AGENCY HEAD)  ARE  HELD  ACCOUNTABLE  FOR
   44  REDUCING IMPROPER PAYMENTS.
   45    S  58.  IMPROPER  PAYMENT  ESTIMATE  GUIDANCE GROUP. 1. THERE SHALL BE
   46  ESTABLISHED, WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH, THE IMPROPER PAYMENT  ESTIMATE
   47  GUIDANCE  GROUP.  SUCH  GROUP  SHALL  BE COMPOSED OF THE DIRECTOR OF THE
   48  BUDGET WHO SHALL CHAIR THE  GROUP,  THE  STATE  INSPECTOR  GENERAL,  THE
   49  INSPECTOR  GENERAL  OF THE METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY AND THE
   50  WELFARE INSPECTOR GENERAL.
   51    2. WITHIN ONE HUNDRED EIGHTY DAYS OF THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS  ARTI-
   52  CLE,  THE  IMPROPER  PAYMENT  ESTIMATE GUIDANCE GROUP SHALL MEET AND, IN
   53  CONSULTATION WITH THE STATE COMPTROLLER, PRESCRIBE  GUIDELINES  FOR  THE
   54  IMPLEMENTATION  OF  THE  PROVISIONS  OF THIS ARTICLE. ALL AGENCIES SHALL
   55  COOPERATE WITH SUCH GROUP TO ASSIST IT AS NECESSARY IN  THE  DEVELOPMENT

       S. 1677                             3

    1  AND PROMULGATION OF GUIDELINES. THE GUIDELINES SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE
    2  LIMITED TO:
    3    A.  THE MANNER IN WHICH AGENCIES SHALL REVIEW PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES,
    4  AND IDENTIFY THOSE WHICH ARE SUSCEPTIBLE TO IMPROPER PAYMENTS;
    5    B. THE MANNER IN WHICH AGENCIES SHALL  CALCULATE  STATISTICALLY  VALID
    6  ESTIMATES  OF  THE  ANNUAL  AMOUNT  OF IMPROPER PAYMENTS IN PROGRAMS AND
    7  ACTIVITIES;
    8    C. THE MANNER IN  WHICH  AGENCIES  SHALL  IMPLEMENT  PLANS  TO  REDUCE
    9  IMPROPER PAYMENTS; AND
   10    D.  THE  MANNER IN WHICH AGENCIES SHALL REPORT ESTIMATES OF THE ANNUAL
   11  AMOUNT OF IMPROPER PAYMENTS IN PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES, AND PROGRESS  IN
   12  REDUCING THEM.
   13    3.  THE IMPROPER PAYMENT ESTIMATE GUIDANCE GROUP SHALL THEREAFTER MEET
   14  AT ANY TIME AT THE CALL OF EITHER THE DIRECTOR  OF  THE  BUDGET  OR  THE
   15  STATE  COMPTROLLER;  PROVIDED  THAT  SUCH GROUP SHALL MEET NO FEWER THAN
   16  ONCE EVERY FOUR YEARS TO REVIEW THE GUIDELINES.
   17    S 59.  APPLICATION OF ARTICLE. THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE SHALL:
   18    1. APPLY TO THE ADMINISTRATION OF PROGRAMS AND IMPROPER PAYMENTS  MADE
   19  IN  STATE  FISCAL YEARS COMMENCING ON OR AFTER APRIL FIRST, TWO THOUSAND
   20  TWELVE; AND
   21    2. REQUIRE THE  INCLUSION  OF  THE  ESTIMATES,  REPORTED  PURSUANT  TO
   22  SECTION  FIFTY-SEVEN-A OF THIS ARTICLE, IN THE AGENCY BUDGET SUBMISSIONS
   23  FOR STATE FISCAL YEARS COMMENCING ON OR AFTER APRIL FIRST, TWO  THOUSAND
   24  THIRTEEN.
   25    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to enacting the "improper payments reporting and reduction act"
